decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By using cheap artifacts and spells like Memnite and Mishra's Bauble, combined with artifact lands like Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly build a powerful board presence. Cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke provide removal and disruption, while Tormod's Crypt and Sink into Stupor disrupt the opponent's graveyard and hand. The deck aims to win through aggressive creature attacks and efficient use of artifacts. It is a fast-paced and aggressive strategy that aims to quickly defeat the opponent.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Phlage and Ragavan with removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win quickly. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional disruption and protection for your creatures. The deck also includes a linear win condition with Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines, allowing you to close out the game efficiently. With a mix of threats and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to put quick pressure on the opponent, while using cards like Guide of Souls and Voice of Victory to provide additional support and resilience. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and some mana disruption with cards like Blood Moon, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures, such as Emrakul and Ulamog, while controlling the board with cards like Kozilek's Command and Through the Breach. The deck utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to support its big plays, while also having utility lands like Sanctum of Ugin and Yggdrasil, Rebirth Engine for additional value. With a mix of control elements and powerful finishers, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and resource denial.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the key pieces needed to ramp up mana and search for important lands like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige. Utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan, the deck aims to create explosive turns by generating a large amount of mana and searching for powerful lands and creatures like Urza's Saga and Primeval Titan. The deck also includes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift to help find specific cards when needed. By carefully managing resources and sequencing plays, the deck can achieve powerful and game-ending combos efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Solitude and Goryo's Vengeance, while controlling the game with cards like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to both protect your combo pieces and generate value, while Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage. Faithful Mending and Ephemerate allow for card selection and recursion, while Teferi, Time Raveler disrupts opponents' strategies. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements and includes some utility lands for additional synergies.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces in order to cheat these creatures into play and overwhelm the opponent with instant-speed threats. The deck also includes disruption through cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. With multiple ways to find and protect the key pieces, this deck aims to win the game in a fast and explosive manner.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells. The deck also aims to gain card advantage through card draw and utility from planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Blood Moon can also provide a significant advantage against decks relying on non-basic lands. The deck has a good mix of instants, sorceries, creatures, and planeswalkers to offer a versatile and adaptive play style in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using artifact creatures and synergistic artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By combining cards that generate mana, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and pump up the power of the creatures, the deck can create a fast and aggressive playstyle that puts pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and use the artifacts' abilities to control the battlefield and win the game through a combination of creature attacks and direct damage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Ephemerate and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and slow down the opponent's strategy by taxing their resources. Cards like Solitude and Witch Enchanter provide removal options while cards like Quantum Riddler and White Orchid Phantom can help maintain card advantage. The deck also utilizes land destruction with cards like Flagstones of Trokair and Marsh Flats to further disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on using instant spells and reanimation effects to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck can quickly put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, the deck runs a variety of interaction spells like Prismatic Ending and Thoughtseize to control the board and protect its key pieces. The deck aims to win through explosive plays and efficient use of its resources to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing small aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to control the game while applying pressure to the opponent. By combining creatures like Phelia, Phlage, and Ragavan with powerful spells like Consign to Memory and March of Otherworldly Light, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily chipping away at their life total. Additionally, cards like Quantum Riddler and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption and card advantage to help maintain control of the game. The deck also includes a mix of lands to provide consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 deck is focused on using a combination of instants, sorceries, artifacts, and creatures to assemble a powerful combo without relying on traditional land cards. Cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lotus Bloom, and Whir of Invention are key pieces in the strategy, with support from disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Disrupting Shoal. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells and removal while setting up a game-winning combo, showcasing a unique and landless approach to winning in Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying multiple artifacts to take advantage of the affinity mechanic and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. It uses efficient artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and card advantage, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt. The deck also includes interaction in the form of metallic rebuke and Sink into Stupor to control the board and protect its threats. The goal is to quickly assemble a powerful board state and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

This Simic aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual to play powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Shardless Agent early on. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive cards like Subtlety and Flare of Denial to control the board and protect your creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Coiling Oracle and Ice-Fang Coatl provides card advantage and additional flexibility in gameplay. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and powerful creatures while maintaining control of the game with disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to maintain card advantage and ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and close out the match before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. The mana base is optimized for casting spells efficiently and consistently throughout the game.

The main focus of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with cheap artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite, and then utilize powerful cards like Arcbound Ravager and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan while buffing your own creatures. The deck also runs efficient mana ramp with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, and has the ability to generate extra value through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga. Overall, the strategy revolves around aggressively building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of speed and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to use Allosaurus Rider to cheat out high-cost creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand, while also utilizing cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for important combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection and disruption, with Planar Genesis providing a potential finisher. The deck focuses on a high-risk, high-reward strategy of quickly ramping into powerful threats and overwhelming the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Amulet of Vigor combo with Primeval Titan to generate a massive amount of mana and quickly overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing land manipulation effects like Arboreal Grazer, Malevolent Rumble, and Crumbling Vestige, the deck aims to ramp into Primeval Titan while maximizing land drop efficiency with cards like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber. With strong protection and utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Urza's Saga, the deck can easily search for key pieces to secure victory through explosive plays and powerful combo interactions.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through land-based strategies, utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to power out large threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing lands that provide additional mana or utility, the deck aims to set up explosive turns where it can either ramp into a huge threat like Cultivator Colossus or combo off with cards like Scapeshift to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Boseiju, Who Endures to help find answers or protect key pieces of the combo.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on utilizing creatures with flash and removal spells to control the board while applying pressure to the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation, while also generating card advantage with Ephemerate and Coiling Oracle. The deck also includes versatile threats like Solitude and Thundertrap Trainer to close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver its opponents in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on a mix of disruptive spells and creatures with powerful ETB effects to control the board and pressure opponents. The deck aims to tempo out opponents by using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate to protect its threats and generate value. By combining efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Coiling Oracle with powerful removal like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents while disrupting their game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's various color requirements.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure and deal damage efficiently, using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to maintain board presence. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to control the battlefield and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach and versatility to close out games.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies combined with disruptive elements to control the opponent's resources. By using a combination of creatures with disruptive abilities, removal spells, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It utilizes a mix of powerful threats like Phelia and Phlage, along with disruptive elements like Quantum Riddler and Consign to Memory, to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to victory. Additionally, the inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on an aggressive strategy that combines disruptive elements with evasive threats to control the board and pressure the opponent. Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide strong creature-based aggression, while Quantum Riddler and Solitude disrupt the opponent's game plan. Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Witch Enchanter help generate card advantage, while Flickerwisp and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional utility. Ephemerate and March of Otherworldly Light offer tempo advantage and protection for key creatures. The deck runs a diverse land base to support its multicolor requirements and enable flexibility in its plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures and spells to hinder the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The main strategy is to disrupt the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while deploying threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Witch Enchanter. The deck also focuses on blinking creatures like Flickerwisp and Quantum Riddler to gain additional value. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to control the tempo of the game and protect the deck's key pieces. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to its spells.

This deck focuses on assembling a fast and powerful equipment combo using Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe, alongside Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic to tutor and equip them efficiently. Memnite and Ornithopter provide quick creature drops to equip the hammers to, while Urza's Saga helps find the necessary pieces. Battlefield Improvisation and Metallic Rebuke provide disruption and protection, while other cards like Shadowspear and Pithing Needle offer additional utility. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a lethal combination of equipment and creature synergy.

This deck aims to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes a mix of disruptive creatures like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd along with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending help control the board while Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption. The deck also includes some flicker effects like Ephemerate and March of Otherworldly Light to generate value from entering the battlefield effects. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and disruption to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to generate as much mana as possible using cards like Ruby Medallion, Desperate Ritual, and Manamorphose to cast powerful spells quickly. By casting multiple spells in a turn, the player can trigger abilities like Ral, Monsoon Mage's and Stormscale Scion's to deal damage to the opponent and generate valuable card advantage. The deck utilizes cards like Pyretic Ritual and Reckless Impulse to help dig for key combo pieces like Past in Flames and Wish, allowing the player to set up explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Birthing Ritual to cast powerful creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes a combination of creatures with flash and powerful instant-speed interaction to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of cards like Subtlety and Endurance helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also providing additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption, ensuring that it can adapt to a variety of matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and utilizing evasive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus, Ice-Fang Coatl, and Shardless Agent to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It also includes disruptive elements like Subtlety and Endurance to control the opponent's strategy, while also including counter spells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation for protection. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression, tempo plays, and disruption to secure a quick victory.

This deck revolves around playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by a mix of efficient burn spells and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. By utilizing a mix of prowess triggers and burn spells, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.
